definition: example/mirror/to view/reflection/to reflect/to inspect/to warn/(ancient bronze mirror)
numeral 2 in Suzhou numeral system 蘇州碼子|苏州码子[Su1 zhou1 ma3 zi5]
"dot" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 3)/see also 點|点[dian3]
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
to learn a lesson from the mistakes of one's predecessor (idiom)
seal impression/stamp/mark from a seal serving as signature
Jianzhen or Ganjin (688-763), Tang dynastic Buddhist monk, who crossed to Japan after several unsuccessful attempts, influential in Japanese Buddhism

sentences.english: The research instrument of this study is available for checking who is an internet addict.
sentences.chinese: 运用本研究所发展之衡鉴工具筛检网路沈迷者。

sentences.english: In the mirror is not popular, people used copper water Kam head-to-head, so-called Kam.
sentences.chinese: 在铜镜未流行前，人们用铜鉴盛水照面，故镜又称鉴。

sentences.english: These are often poor examples of failed blogs and should represent everything you oppose.
sentences.chinese: 这些博客往往是失败的范例，等着你引之为鉴。

definition: worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
ancient cooking cauldron with two looped handles and three or four legs/pot (dialect)/to enter upon a period of (classical)/Kangxi radical 206/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes
article/commodity/product/goods/kind/grade/rank/character/disposition/nature/temperament/variety/to taste sth/to sample/to criticize/to comment/to judge/to size up/fret (on a guitar or lute)
canon/law/standard work of scholarship/literary quotation or allusion/ceremony/to be in charge of/to mortgage or pawn
after all/to investigate/to study carefully/Taiwan pr. [jiu4]
to enjoy offered food and drink
to spread out/to develop/to overflow/to amplify/superfluous
